name: Graeme J. Yeates
title: Web Developer/GIS Specialist
objective: Geographic information systems (GIS) internship that allows me to integrate my knowledge of web development and databases with my skills in GIS.
aboutme: I study GIS and computer science at the University of Waterloo, am an enthusiast programmer, and a contributor to several open source projects (see my github profile). My work strategy involves seperating jobs into into tasks, then assigning their priorities and deadlines. I'm always searching for new automation techniques and ways optimize my workflow.

projects.name: MutationObserver.js
projects.technologies: QUnit, Grunt, Travis CI, PhantomJS, Sauce Labs
projects.description: Created a (reasonably) compliant and well optimized shim of the HTML5 MutationObserver using a novel tree reconciliation algorithm. Created 50+ QUnit tests for the polyfill.

projects.name: QwebIRC
projects.technologies: Mootools, Twitter Bootstrap, Epitome MVC, Handlebars, Grunt, socket.io, underscore, CSS3, HTML5
projects.description: QwebIRC is a free, open source AJAX instant relay chat (IRC) client designed to be simple, feature-rich, and intuitive. I've improved the extensibility and functionality of the original QwebIRC project by abstracting the browser hacks to frameworks and modules, rewriting the entire user interface (UI) in templated Views, decoupling of the IRC client from the UI and making the code DRY by extending the utility module. The changes have removed unnessary relationships and made adding features less trivial.

projects.name: Python WebIRC
projects.description: Created a localization strategy and implemented the Ident dameon protocol for connecting to secure servers.

projects.name: Epitome MVC
projects.description: Contributor to the framework. Improved the functionality of model properties and provided two solutions to passing events with an array in the arguments

experience.title: Geomatics Applications Developer
experience.technologies: ASP.net, VB, SQL, ArcGIS SDKs, ArcGIS Online, jQuery, dojo, CSS3, HTML5
experience.responsibilities: Created various AJAX service end points and developed administration pages in ASP.NET. Refined the processes of merging contents of a client's file geodatabases into the CESI Microsoft SQL server database. Refactored the air toxics and emissions indicator 'data entities' and added new layers data validation.
experience.achievements: Participated in a group in a working group responsible for creating a standard web mapping platform (RAMP) for various CESI projects. Mainly worked on implementing localization and transfering state data. Removed serious security holes in the public web services.

experience.title: IT Intern
experience.responsibilities: Built custom, data driven financial applications using Java for coworkers. These applications had to keep up to date with multiple, periodically updated SQL databases on different servers. Respond to technical questions and provide solutions to problems.
experience.achievements: Commensed merge of a relatively large Microsoft Access 2000 database into a database in the main Microsoft SQL 2005 server. Created and maintained several SQL databases.
